principle.name: Context-Aware Translation Keys
principle.description: Use descriptive, context-aware translation keys that help translators understand usage
principle.rationale: Improves translation quality and reduces ambiguity

example.scenario: Naming translation keys for UI elements

principle.name: Pluralization Support
principle.description: Implement proper pluralization rules for all languages
principle.rationale: Different languages have different pluralization rules (English: singular/plural, Arabic: singular/dual/plural)

example.good: Use ICU pluralization: {count, plural, one {# item} other {# items}}
example.bad: Simple if-else logic that only works for English

principle.name: RTL Language Support
principle.description: Design layouts that support right-to-left languages
principle.rationale: Proper RTL support requires layout changes, not just text direction

example.good: Use logical CSS properties and test RTL layouts

convention.rule: Use dot notation with descriptive namespaces

convention.template: locales/ ├── en/ │ ├── common.json │ ├── auth.json │ └── dashboard.json ├── fr/ │ ├── common.json │ ├── auth.json │ └── dashboard.json └── ar/ ├── common.json ├── auth.json └── dashboard.json

convention.rule: Use ICU message format for complex strings
convention.template: "greeting": "Hello {name}, you have {count, plural, one {# message} other {# messages}}"

pitfall.why_problematic: Word order varies by language, breaking translations
pitfall.correct_approach: Use interpolation with ICU message format

pitfall.why_problematic: Translations can be 30-40% longer than English
pitfall.correct_approach: Design layouts that accommodate text expansion

category.name: implementation
category.item: All user-facing strings are extracted to translation files
Pluralization rules implemented for target languages
Translation keys are descriptive and context-aware

category.name: functionality
category.item: Language switching works without page reload
Dynamic content updates with language changes

category.item: Dates formatted according to locale conventions
